reviews.comment: 0/5 if I could... Friedlander is the worst. He forgets to upload resources, makes typos on slides/assignments, ignores all questions about logistics/exams, does not give practice problems, forgets to attend office hours, etc. He is lucky that Victor was an awesome TA and carried the course. Do not take this course if you didn't do MATH 220 or 223!

Many mistakes on his slides, and because the lecture is math related, it makes you very confuse!!! NO any information about the test, no answer for the homework, no past paper. But the tests are almost multiple choices. Prepare to learn by yourself.

The people whining about this course clearly didn't take many other courses at UBC. Dr. Friedlander teaches otherwise difficult things in an intuitive way. An issue with the course: some TAs, except a couple, clearly weren't familiar with the material and their grading was weird. TA assignments need to be more thorough for this course. Easy stuff.

No any information about any test, no exercises. No answers for homework. You will not review any feedback while you learning. The lecture content is math heavy. Makes you perform very bad on tests. There are many mistakes in his lectures, which makes you confuse.

Michael is really knowledgeable about the field he teaches. I learned new things every time he spoke. His lectures were quite good, and his tests were very fair. Assignments could be annoying to do since what we could or could not do was unclear. The software used (Julia Pluto) could be tricky to get working. I learned a ton and highly recommend.
This prof is absolutely fantastic. His lectures are engaging, and his assignments are interesting. Midterm was easy, and he's very friendly to talk to.

Took him Spring 2015. In lecture, he made everything seem so simple. When the tests came around, they were pretty difficult. Lectures don't prepare you for exams. Weekly webworks weren't that bad. Not enough time for tests were given. Nice guy, wants you to succeed.
He was very charming that is why my freind and I went to class. Not the best lecturer but his exams were very easy! expect to self teach yourself!

This guy is a programmer, not a mathematician, and it shows.  He stumbles and stumbles over the arithmetic of linear algebra and doesn't explain many things clearly unless asked.  He's not all bad, but I wouldn't take a class from him again.
Great prof, I can't tell if the course is really easy or he's just a great prof.

I found the course to be quite difficult but incredibly interesting and useful material. Dr. Friedlander's midterms and final exam were very fair, and the homework assignments were a little bit on the difficult side because I am not an expert in MATLAB programming. Overall, I recommend him! I would take another class with him.
